definition[0]: a deep line or fold in the skin of someone’s face, especially on the forehead
example[0]: A deep furrow appeared between his brows.
definition[1]: a wide deep line made in the surface of something, especially the ground
example[1]: the regular furrows of a plowed field
example[2]: The river cuts a long straight furrow between the hills.
definition[2]: to make the skin on your face form deep lines or folds, especially because you are worried or thinking hard
definition[3]: to make a wide deep line in the surface of something
